intro: Polyalthia dubia var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smooth-leaved polyalthia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species for horticultural cultivation.
